definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
in a great rush/in a flurry
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about

sentences.english: He was always excited by his life and busy with where it was going.
sentences.chinese: 他總是爲他的生活而興奮，忙着它要去的地方。

sentences.english: I think you are too busy to take an afternoon off.
sentences.chinese: 我想你們真是忙得連個下午都抽不出來了。

sentences.english: I've been as busy as a bee all day doing my spring - cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 大掃除使得我一整天一直忙得不可開交。

sentences.english: He could really help you, if you needed him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要他的話，他真能幫上你的忙。

sentences.english: He sometimes stays at the office alone when he's on a case.
sentences.chinese: 一忙起來，他就經常獨自一人待在辦公室。

sentences.english: Sorry, the number you dail is busy now. Please dail it again later.
sentences.chinese: 您好，您所撥打的電話正忙，請稍後再撥。

sentences.english: NASA research satellites or long-duration high-altitude flights might also help.
sentences.chinese: NASA的研究衛星或長期的高空飛行也可以幫上忙。

sentences.english: No, I don't think I have any plans. Why do you ask?
sentences.chinese: 不忙，我想我沒什麼安排。你問來幹嘛？

sentences.english: If you are busy at all, we might come to talk to you sometime next week.
sentences.chinese: 如果你確實很忙，我們在下週某個時候來跟你說。

sentences.english: He was kept busy disposing of his heap of manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 他忙着處理他那一大堆舊稿。

sentences.english: Asked what he was busy, he said that reading.
sentences.chinese: 問他在忙什麼，他說在看書。

sentences.english: As if attending to these curst cocks and hens here were not enough work for any girl.
sentences.chinese: 好像照看這些公雞和母雞還不夠一個女孩子忙的。

sentences.english: Bees are busy working and birds are singing in the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂忙着工作，小鳥在藍天中歌唱。

sentences.english: In the past, many of the, were underpaid and lived from hand to mouth.
sentences.chinese: 過去，他們許多人工資低微，吃了上頓忙下頓。

definition: to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to putter around/to work to no avail
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
in a busy and hasty manner
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
